page.title: 04JESMOND DENE - PART ONE
page.content:
The Dene was designed and owned by Lord Armstrong.
Armstrong Bridge is a big feature of the Dene. Unfortunately the bridge is too weak and dangerous for traffic use but an Arts and Crafts market is held on Sundays on the bridge.
On a sunny day people will flock to the Dene to enjoy the weather. There are many birds and animals using the Dene as their home. Pets' Corner has a number of animals in it for the people to look at.
The Ouseburn runs through the Dene from which an old mill harnessed its energy. Today the mill is disused and forms another tourist attraction.
